definitions: Relating to or denoting a style of painting developed from impressionism in the late 19th century, characterized by a concern for the emotional and symbolic content of art and a rejection of the impressionists' concern with the naturalistic depiction of light and color.
examples: The museum has a remarkable collection of post-impressionist art.
Van Gogh is a well-known post-impressionist painter.
She studied post-impressionist techniques in art school.
